result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A Egide was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid within 90 days.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle A Egide

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:13 AM Defendant Kyle A Egide in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as it relates to his waiver of right to an attorney.
The Defendant wishes to waive his right to an attorney.
The Court finds that the Defendant is freely, knowingly, and voluntarily waiving his right to an attorney.

The Court conducts a plea colloquy with the Defendant.
The Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1.
The Court finds the Defendant guilty of Count 1.

The State gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defense gives its sentencing recommendation.
The Defendant presents a statement.

Court orders the following:	

Costs/Fine:  $473.50
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Payment of Fine/Forfeiture/Costs/Surcharges:  To be paid in 90 days. Civil judgment to be entered as penalty for non payment.

HOW TO PAY:
Payments can be made on-line with a MasterCard or electronic check at:  http://wcca.wicourts.gov  (Read the agreement, the click "I agree," then click "Pay fees on-line.")  OR you may contact the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts Business Center at 262-548-7497.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:58 AM Defendant Kyle A Egide in court, in custody, with attorney Michael E Banaszak.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Charlie Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
